snippet: The Yankees spent $153 million to lure away Jacoby Ellsbury from the Red Sox, who made a one-year, $750,000 deal with Grady Sizemore to help replace him.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that New York Yankees spent $153 million to lure away outfielder Jacoby Ellsbury from Boston Red Sox, who made a one-year, $750,000 deal with Grady Sizemore to help replace him; holds that Yankees need Ellsbury to stay on the field and be the best version of himself, while Red Sox are paying far less to Sizemore, and asking less of him, too.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees spent $153 million to lure away Jacoby Ellsbury from the Red Sox, who made a one-year, $750,000 deal with Grady Sizemore to help replace him.

headline.main: Two Gambles on Outfielders, but One Costs Millions More
headline.print_headline: Two Risks, but One Costs Millions More
